args:
Alberius and the others safely arrive at the
cathedral and meet the leader of the Ilian
Church alliance. Seeking recognition as the
hero of the sacred sword, Alberius seeks out
the Holywyrm Elysium, and a trial ensues.
So this is the cathedralâ€”the seat of\nthe Ilian Church's power in the\nsouthern part of the continent.
And a critical location in the battle\nagainst the Empire.
Come, then. Let me introduce you.
I doubted your tale at first, Myriam,\nbut it seems you have indeed found\nthe legendary dragonblood hero.

Yes. In battle with the Empire did the
sacred sword and one of dragonblood
come to meet... It must be the guidance
of the Goddess.
Then he truly is the hero of Dragalia!
Truly, the Goddess has cast her watchful\neye upon us as we spare no effort to\nhold the front in this war.
It's a miracle, so it is!
We'll spread the news far and wide\nuntil even the imperials know of it!
Is it not rather soon for such things?\nWe do not know if this man is suitable\nto carry on Ilia's will, after all.
But he has drawn the sacred sword,\nwhich means he is the dragonblood hero\nforetold in prophecy!

Exactly! He's been sent by the Goddess
to save us from our predicamentâ€”
and the sooner we tell the imperials,
the sooner they turn tail and run!
The Curia commanded me to direct this\nholy war against the villainous Empire.
I cannot so lightly make key decisions\npertaining to the future of the alliance.
Now then, it is true that none but those\nof the dragonblood can hope to wield\nthe sacred sword.
However, merely wielding the sword does\nnot automatically make one WORTHY of it.
I have spoken to you about using my\nproper name in public spaces, Myriam.
Oh! Er, forgive me, Cardinal Lambert.
But I can vouch for the quality of this\nman's characterâ€”he IS worthy.
And I have made no indication\nthat I would not accept him.
Dragalia is a holy relic passed down since\nantiquity; it is not meant to be entrusted\nto a soul of easy resolve.
Thus, Alberius. I would put you to a test\nand determine if you truly are worthy to\nwield that most holy of blades.

It was never my intention for all of you
to hail me as a hero merely on my say-so,
but neither have I come here merely to
satisfy a fleeting whim.
If you wish to test me, I accept your trial.
If you truly are the hero of legend,\na certain dragon will answer your call.
I speak, of course, of Elysium,\nthe Holywyrm.
I must say, I was rather surprised to learn\nyour father is the leader of the alliance.

I wasn't trying to conceal it from you.
I just... Well, I guess there is a bit of
distance between the two of us.
I'm sorry if I was not forthcoming.
You've nothing to apologize for. Besides,\nthe pressing issue here is whether or not\nI can truly meet with the Holywyrm.
All I can tell you is that the Gate of the\nForbidden Dominion is said to respond\nto the dragonblood.
And that gate leads to Elysium's domain?
Yes. If this gate is opened, it will grant you\nan audience with Elysium.
And if you win the Holywyrm's approval...
Then none can hope to oppose him,\nI take it?
This is the Gate of the Forbidden\nDominion, but I see no way to open it.
Likely the Holywyrm has transported us\nto its forbidden dominion.
I have been waiting for you, dragonblood.\nAnd you as well, Windwyrm.
You are the Holywyrm of legend...
Yet I am also order itself, and the one\nwho oversees the world entire.
I became aware of the signs of the\nOther's return, and so did I wait.
For I suspected that one day a descendant\nof those who partook in the light of my\npactstone would come before me.

There is a thing I do not know, Holywyrm:
With your power, the defeat of the Other
could be realized, so why do you entrust
that duty to mere humans?
As this is our first meeting with the new\nlife you have gained, Windwyrm, I shall\ndeign to answer your query.
It is because of the pact which continues\nfrom the era of myself and Ilia.

People were given the mission to defeat
the Other, and as such Ilia swore to spread
the creed amongst them and take on the
task of defeating him for all time.
In that case, Holywyrm,\nI would have you judge me:
Am I worthy of wielding this sword?\nDo I have resolve to face the Other?
Indeed I shallâ€”else I would not have\nmanifested before you.
I shall measure your courage and resolve\nto challenge meâ€”along with your ability.
If your strength and spirit are found to be\nwithout wanting, then I shall entrust you\nwith Dragalia.
Then I will face you with all that I am\nso the conviction of my blade is doubtless!
